New Records: Josh Hart posted his third triple-double of the season and the ninth of his career, the fourth-most in New York Knicks team history.
Key Match Events: Josh Hart finished with 23 points, 15 rebounds, and 10 assists.
Karl-Anthony Towns had a double-double with 32 points and 13 rebounds.
OG Anunoby scored 18 points and grabbed eight rebounds.
Jonas Valanciunas scored 22 points off the bench for the Wizards.
Malcolm Brogdon and Alexandre Sarr each scored 18 points for the Wizards.
Corey Kispert finished with 16 points for the Wizards.
The Knicks took control with a 13-5 run to lead 97-88 at the end of the third quarter.
The Knicks maintained a double-digit lead for the final eight minutes and opened up a 21-point lead at 120-99 on Towns’ dunk with 4:21 left.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Knicks extended their winning streak to eight games, their longest since a nine-game run from Jan. 17-Feb. 1 this year.
